snippet.textDisplay:
capcom: any new ideas?
employee: make a remake of a remake of a game that has been ported to more consoles/handhelds than any other game. except for tetris.
capcom: great idea!
snippet.textOriginal:
capcom: any new ideas?

snippet.textDisplay: Its just an hd rerelease of the remake and the remake was exclusive for nintendo it was only on the gamecube and wii this is the first time its ported for other consoles other than nintendo's so i dont understand why alot of pepole are hating capcom for this im happy that alot of pepole will get to play this masterpiece of a game alot of pepole never played the remake and even thought i played it before im gonna buy it again been a long time since i played and to support the game of course.

snippet.textDisplay: Rayman 2.
snippet.textOriginal: Rayman 2.

snippet.textDisplay: This track by far for me is one of my all time vg music favorites. There is a bit of a calming presence to the music when it plays (mostly because you've been walking around with mostly silence the entire game), but also has a feel of disturbing mystery that you're just about to unearth.
snippet.textOriginal: This track by far for me is one of my all time vg music favorites. There is a bit of a calming presence to the music when it plays (mostly because you've been walking around with mostly silence the entire game), but also has a feel of disturbing mystery that you're just about to unearth.

snippet.textDisplay: El mejor Resident Evil de todos con un soundtrack perfecto y terrorífico.

snippet.textDisplay: The best Resident Evil of all time!
snippet.textOriginal: The best Resident Evil of all time!

snippet.textDisplay: My favorite Resident Evil and remake ever, this is almost the textbook perfect horror game. I enjoyed the original version on the PS1, but this flawless remake is simply better in every way. Still today, the graphics are superb and exploring the meticulously designed mansion is always a (terrifying) joy. The first encounter with a crimson head was especially memorable.
snippet.textOriginal: My favorite Resident Evil and remake ever, this is almost the textbook perfect horror game. I enjoyed the original version on the PS1, but this flawless remake is simply better in every way. Still today, the graphics are superb and exploring the meticulously designed mansion is always a (terrifying) joy. The first encounter with a crimson head was especially memorable.

snippet.textDisplay: Along with Silent Hill 2, this game remains to be one of the most iconic horror games of all time.

snippet.textDisplay: Not to mention the voice acting in the Gamecube version is miles better than the PS1 version.
